result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark R Schneider was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Threat to Law Enforcement Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Revoked (Misdemeanor)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to Count 3. Conditions of probation are the same as conditions of extended supervision.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs of the action. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: of Plea and Sentencing Hearing held 2/28/17

Defendant Mark R Schneider in court with attorney Christa Johnson. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises of plea agreement. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 2, 3, 5. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 2, 3, 5. Counts 1 and 4 are dismissed but read in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.
to Transport

Defendant Mark R Schneider appeared by phone from Oshkosh Correctional Institution. Attorney Christa Johnson appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests plea/sentencing be scheduled for next Tuesday.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 28, 2017 at 10:15 am.
Phone conference set up with Oshkosh Correctional for 2/23/17 at 1:30.
from Defense confirming rescheduling
Pre-trial conference on February 23, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on March 15, 2017 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Mark R Schneider appeared by phone from Oshkosh Correctional. Attorney Christa Johnson appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense requests that case be set for trial and pre-trial. Court questions how long trial will take. State has 9 witnesses, thinks it should be set for 2 days just in case. Defense agrees. Set for 2 day jury trial and pre-trial.

Defendant Mark R Schneider appeared by phone from Oshkosh Correctional Institution. Attorney Christa Johnson appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions status. Defense advises that offer is still being reviewed, requests continuance to determine if case will settle or be set for trial. State has no objection.  Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Mark R Schneider appeared by video from Oshkosh Correctional Institution. Attorney Christa Johnson appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense advises of appointment, advises of extensive discovery, requests status in 30 days.  Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 08:45 am.
Change of Attorney
Video conference confirmed for 8/23 with Oshkosh Correctional.
from DA's office to Court requesting video conference for 8/23 hearing. Per Court, video ok.
